A **small shield** is a type of [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [5.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.7 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

[Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") and [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") start each game with a +0 small shield.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") start each game with a +3 small shield.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Lines of code are present that give [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)"), [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") and [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") characters in roles that start with small shields a race-appropriate shield instead, though only the line regarding orcs and [orcish shields](/wiki/Orcish_shield "Orcish shield") not being commented out, and this line has no applicable roles.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

[Mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") have a 2⁄3 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") small shields.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) [Aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"), [high priests](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") and the [Arch Priest](/wiki/Arch_Priest "Arch Priest") always generate with a small shield.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

## Description

While worn, a small shield grants 1 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"). The [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") penalty for a worn small shield is much lower than other shield types, due to its low weight.[\[9\]](#cite_note-penalty-9)

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Shield § Strategy](/wiki/Shield#Strategy "Shield")*

The small shield is the best shield by far for spellcasters and characters with low [carrying capacity](/wiki/Carrying_capacity "Carrying capacity") - characters in other roles or builds may consider sticking with a highly-enchanted small shield in the long term if they have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") covered by other slots. An [elven shield](/wiki/Elven_shield "Elven shield") may be a superior option depending on a character's exact needs: it has higher base AC and can be enchanted safely from +5, in exchange for weighing 10 more [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") and inhibiting spellcasting more than the small shield.

A Valkyrie's starting small shield is worth wearing for a long time due to its high enchantment, though many of them eventually ditch the shield so they can [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon").

## History

The small shield first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), where it replaces the [shield](/index.php?title=Shield_\(item\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shield (item) (page does not exist)") from [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e") and previous versions - this shield is somewhat similar to the small shield, but is [metallic](/wiki/Metallic "Metallic") and susceptible to rust.

## Variants

In variants with [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") systems, shields larger than the small shield may be exempt from additional spellcasting penalties if they are made of a lightweight, non-metallic material such as [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone") or [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood").[\[9\]](#cite_note-penalty-9)

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), Priests start the game with a +2 small shield.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), the small shield is renamed to the **buckler**, and it grants 1 base AC and 0 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") while worn.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), small shields are surpassed as the ideal shield for spellcasting by elven shields, since they work identically due to spellcasting system changes - the small shield's slightly lower weight is one of its few advantages in comparison.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a small shield can be combined with an [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") to create a [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), all racial replacements for roles starting with small shields are commented out.

Mercenaries that are not [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") or [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") have a 2⁄3 chance of being generated with small shields.

A small shield can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") and a [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet"); a small shield and an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger") can be combined to create an elven shield.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Warriors](/wiki/Warrior "Warrior") and [Paladins](/wiki/Paladin_\(role\) "Paladin (role)") start each game with a +0 small shield. Dwarvish, elven and orcish characters in roles that start with small shields will start the game with a race-appropriate shield instead.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), upgrading a small shield will produce an elven shield, and vice versa.

Elven Knights can upgrade their starting small shield into an elven shield with relative ease.
